threshAgentCompany.name: threshAgentCompany
threshAgentCompany.description: Agent's company name (e.g. Fujitsu Siemens Computers)

threshAgentBuild.name: threshAgentBuild
threshAgentBuild.description: Compilation time and date of agent program

threshConfigurationChanged.name: threshConfigurationChanged
threshConfigurationChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last configuration modification time at any table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

threshThresholdStatus.name: threshThresholdStatus
threshThresholdStatus.description: Replies the current threshold status, whether threshold monitoring is enabled and currently active: unknown: unknown status (problem in underlying threshold management services?) disabled: no enabled rulesets available enabledNotActive: ruleset(s) enabled, but no one currently active (in terms of time) active: rulesets enabled and threshold monitoring currently active error: a severe error happened in the threshold manager - no thresholds activated

threshReportStatus.name: threshReportStatus
threshReportStatus.description: Replies the current report status, whether report monitoring is enabled and currently active: unknown: unknown status (problem in underlying report management services?) disabled: no enabled reportsets available enabledNotActive: reportset(s) enabled, but no one currently active (in terms of time) active: reportsets enabled and report monitoring currently active error: a severe error happened in the report manager - no reports activated

threshLastSetResultMessage.name: threshLastSetResultMessage
threshLastSetResultMessage.description: Result message of last SET operation. Useful for debugging purpose when testing SNMP client software.

threshPerformanceStatus.name: threshPerformanceStatus
threshPerformanceStatus.description: Information about the server performance: the worst value of all active thresholds; the severity of each rule is defined with object 'threshRulePerfStatusSeverity': unknown: unknown status (problem in underlying threshold management services?) normal: all active thresholds are in normal range (no thresholds exceeded) informational: one or more thresholds with 'informational' severity exceeded warning: one or more thresholds with 'warning' severity exceeded critical: one or more thresholds with 'critical' severity exceeded

threshRuleTable.name: threshRuleTable
threshRuleTable.description: Description of all rules for threshold management

threshRuleUserComment.name: threshRuleUserComment
threshRuleUserComment.description: Comment which can be set by the user; will be sent with event

threshRuleHelpText.name: threshRuleHelpText
threshRuleHelpText.description: Detailed description of the rule (for dynamic generation of help pages)

threshRuleResourceName.name: threshRuleResourceName
threshRuleResourceName.description: Name of monitored resource (index in ResourceTable)

threshRuleInstMonitor.name: threshRuleInstMonitor
threshRuleInstMonitor.description: Resource instances monitoring type - defines how to handle multiple instances: any: any of the instances meets condition average: the average of all instances meets condition

threshRuleInstIndexes.name: threshRuleInstIndexes
threshRuleInstIndexes.description: Resource instances index value list (regular expression, like '[1-5]' (indexes 1..5), '[1,2,5]' (indexes 1, 2, or 5), '1[2-4]' (indexes 12..14); monitor all instances if empty

threshRuleInstPatterns.name: threshRuleInstPatterns
threshRuleInstPatterns.description: Resource instances index pattern list (regular expression, like '^/root$|^/home$|^/opt' (one of /root, /home or /opt*), '^data$|^system[1-3]$' (one of 'data' or 'system1'...'system3'); monitor all instances if empty.

threshRuleTargetName.name: threshRuleTargetName
threshRuleTargetName.description: Name of an entry in the TargetTable, where to send the data queries to (localhost if empty)

threshRuleValueType.name: threshRuleValueType
threshRuleValueType.description: Type of value monitoring (absolute, delta): absolute: the current (absolute) value is tested to meet condition deltaAny: the delta to the value of the previous poll interval is tested (not regarding whether value increase or decrease) deltaIncrease: only increasing delta values are tested deltaDecrease: only decreasing delta values are tested

threshRuleValuation.name: threshRuleValuation
threshRuleValuation.description: Rule valuation - defines how a value is measured: singleValue: one single value is tested to meet condition averageLinear: sum of all measured values devided by the number of values averageMuted: last value plus (delta value divided by 2)

threshRuleWatchPeriod.name: threshRuleWatchPeriod
threshRuleWatchPeriod.description: Monitoring period described as number of polling cycles (for average value calculation)

threshRuleOperator.name: threshRuleOperator
threshRuleOperator.description: Operator to be applied on the monitored resource; the rule applies when the monitored value is: equal: equal to the threshold value (object 'threshRuleThresholdValue') notEqual: not equal to the threshold value less: less than the threshold value lessOrEqual: less than or equal to the threshold value greater: greater than the threshold value greaterOrEqual: greater than or equal to the threshold value withinRange: within the specified threshold value range (objects 'threshRuleRangeMinValue and 'threshRuleRangeMaxValue') outOfRange: out of the specified threshold value range existToNonExist: value existed and now no longer exists nonExistToExist: value did not exist and now exists existChange: value existence changed (in any way)

threshRuleRangeMinValue.name: threshRuleRangeMinValue
threshRuleRangeMinValue.description: Lower threshold range value (for range operators; x >= min value)

threshRuleRangeMaxValue.name: threshRuleRangeMaxValue
threshRuleRangeMaxValue.description: Upper threshold range value (for range operators; open interval --> x < max value)

threshRuleOccurenceCount.name: threshRuleOccurenceCount
threshRuleOccurenceCount.description: The occurence counter for event generation: if count is 0 or 1, event is generated on every occurence, else event is generated after the specified number of continuous rule occurences

threshRuleEventName.name: threshRuleEventName
threshRuleEventName.description: Name of the event (from EventTable) to be created when condition is met

threshRuleEventControl.name: threshRuleEventControl
threshRuleEventControl.description: The frequency of event generation: singleShot: only once until condition is not met again continuous: event raises at every poll cycle when the rule meets condition continousDelay: like 'continous', but not before a delay (object 'threshRuleEventDelay') has passed or the rule met 'good condition' in the mean time

threshRuleEventDelay.name: threshRuleEventDelay
threshRuleEventDelay.description: The minimum delay (in number of poll cycles) after that an event will be sent again if object 'threshRuleEventFrequency' is set to 'continuousDelay'

threshRuleEventAlternating.name: threshRuleEventAlternating
threshRuleEventAlternating.description: If true, an event is also sent when condition is no longer met (good condition)

threshRuleRowStatus.name: threshRuleRowStatus
threshRuleRowStatus.description: Rule table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

threshRuleStorageType.name: threshRuleStorageType
threshRuleStorageType.description: Rule table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshRuleCurrentValue.name: threshRuleCurrentValue
threshRuleCurrentValue.description: Current name(s) and value(s) of the rule, delivered as XML string: root tag is <Values>, each value enclosed by tag <Val Name=OID Type=Type>, e.g. <Val Name=''1.3.6.1.4.1.231.2.10.2.1.18.1.11.2'' Type=''std::integer''>66</Val>; for multiple instances the <Val> tag appears multiple times. ATTENTION: Currently this object can only be used with non-SNMP resources! For SNMP resources the manager must get this value directly using its OID.

threshRuleFireEvent.name: threshRuleFireEvent
threshRuleFireEvent.description: Fire this event (for testing purpose): write a non-zero value to fire this event (reading this value always returns zero)

threshRulePerfStatusSeverity.name: threshRulePerfStatusSeverity
threshRulePerfStatusSeverity.description: How to set the PerformanceStatus when the rule meets condition: ignore: rule status is not considered in the PerformanceStatus informational: when the rule meets condition, the PerformanceStatus goes to 'informational' warning: when the rule meets condition, the PerformanceStatus goes to 'warning' critical: when the rule meets condition, the PerformanceStatus goes to 'critical'

threshRuleTableChanged.name: threshRuleTableChanged
threshRuleTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of rule table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

threshRulesetTable.name: threshRulesetTable
threshRulesetTable.description: Description of all rulesets for threshold management

threshRulesetStartTime.name: threshRulesetStartTime
threshRulesetStartTime.description: Time when to start (activate) this ruleset (optional, -1 if not available; minutes since midnight).

threshRulesetStopTime.name: threshRulesetStopTime
threshRulesetStopTime.description: Time when to stop this ruleset (optional, -1 if not available; minutes since midnight).

threshRulesetRunning.name: threshRulesetRunning
threshRulesetRunning.description: Shows whether the ruleset is currently running (regarding to start/stop time)

threshRulesetRowStatus.name: threshRulesetRowStatus
threshRulesetRowStatus.description: Ruleset table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, notInService, createAndGo, createAndWait, destroy

threshRulesetStorageType.name: threshRulesetStorageType
threshRulesetStorageType.description: Ruleset table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshRulesetContentsTable.name: threshRulesetContentsTable
threshRulesetContentsTable.description: Content mapping table of all rulesets for threshold management Index 1 is from the RulesetTable, index 2 is a rule number (not stored in database).

threshRulesetContentsRuleIndex.name: threshRulesetContentsRuleIndex
threshRulesetContentsRuleIndex.description: Ruleset contents table rule number (second index; 1..n; this number is not stored in the ruleset database)

threshRulesetContentsRuleName.name: threshRulesetContentsRuleName
threshRulesetContentsRuleName.description: Ruleset contents table rule name - this name must match to an entry in the rule table! If the rule is missing in the rule table, it will be ignored here.

threshRulesetContentsRowStatus.name: threshRulesetContentsRowStatus
threshRulesetContentsRowStatus.description: Ruleset contents table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

threshRulesetContentsStorageType.name: threshRulesetContentsStorageType
threshRulesetContentsStorageType.description: Ruleset contents table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshRulesetsChanged.name: threshRulesetsChanged
threshRulesetsChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of ruleset or ruleset contents table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

threshEventTable.name: threshEventTable
threshEventTable.description: Event destinations for threshold event creation

threshEventType.name: threshEventType
threshEventType.description: Type of event (SNMP trap,...) For SNMP traps the trap numbers and enterprise ID are predefined and apply to the trap definitions in this MIB.

threshEventSeverity.name: threshEventSeverity
threshEventSeverity.description: Severity of event (e.g. for SNMP traps). For SNMP traps this severity defines which one of the predefined traps is to be sent.

threshEventRowStatus.name: threshEventRowStatus
threshEventRowStatus.description: Event table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

threshEventStorageType.name: threshEventStorageType
threshEventStorageType.description: Event table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshEventTableChanged.name: threshEventTableChanged
threshEventTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of event table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

reportTable.name: reportTable
reportTable.description: Description of all reports for report management

reportUserComment.name: reportUserComment
reportUserComment.description: Comment which can be set by the user; will be sent with event

reportHelpText.name: reportHelpText
reportHelpText.description: Detailed description of the report (for dynamic generation of help pages)

reportMaxEntries.name: reportMaxEntries
reportMaxEntries.description: Maximum number of recorded report entries (prevent from getting hard disk out of space; 0 = no limit).

reportResourceName.name: reportResourceName
reportResourceName.description: Name of monitored resource (index in ResourceTable)

reportInstMonitor.name: reportInstMonitor
reportInstMonitor.description: Resource instances monitoring type - defines how to handle multiple instances: all: all of the instances are monitored average: the average of all instances is calculated and monitored

reportInstIndexes.name: reportInstIndexes
reportInstIndexes.description: Resource instances index value list (regular expression, like '[1-5]' (indexes 1..5), '[1,2,5]' (indexes 1, 2, or 5), '1[2-4]' (indexes 12..14); monitor all instances if empty

reportInstPatterns.name: reportInstPatterns
reportInstPatterns.description: Resource instances index pattern list (regular expression, like '^/root$|^/home$|^/opt' (one of /root, /home or /opt*), '^data$|^system[1-3]$' (one of 'data' or 'system1'...'system3'); monitor all instances if empty.

reportTargetName.name: reportTargetName
reportTargetName.description: Name of an entry in the TargetTable, where to send the data queries to (localhost if empty)

reportRowStatus.name: reportRowStatus
reportRowStatus.description: Report table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

reportStorageType.name: reportStorageType
reportStorageType.description: Report table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

reportCurrentValue.name: reportCurrentValue
reportCurrentValue.description: Current name(s) and value(s) of the report resource, delivered as XML string: root tag is <Values>, each value enclosed by tag <Val Name=OID Type=Type>, e.g. <Val Name=''1.3.6.1.4.1.231.2.10.2.1.18.1.11.2'' Type=''std::integer''>66</Val>; for multiple instances the <Val> tag appears multiple times. ATTENTION: Currently this object can only be used with non-SNMP resources! For SNMP resources the manager must get this value directly using its OID.

reportTableChanged.name: reportTableChanged
reportTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of report table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

reportSetTable.name: reportSetTable
reportSetTable.description: Description of all reports set properties for report management

reportSetName.name: reportSetName
reportSetName.description: Short report set name, used for identication

reportSetStartTime.name: reportSetStartTime
reportSetStartTime.description: Time when to start (activate) this report set (optional, -1 if not available; minutes since midnight).

reportSetStopTime.name: reportSetStopTime
reportSetStopTime.description: Time when to stop this report set (optional, -1 if not available; minutes since midnight).

reportSetRecordingEnd.name: reportSetRecordingEnd
reportSetRecordingEnd.description: Date when reporting should be finished (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01; 0 = no end date, must be stopped manually) Reporting terminates automatically either when the next day after the end date or the maximum entry limit is reached.

reportSetRunning.name: reportSetRunning
reportSetRunning.description: Shows whether the report set is currently running (regarding to start/stop time)

reportSetRowStatus.name: reportSetRowStatus
reportSetRowStatus.description: Report set table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, notInService, createAndGo, createAndWait, destroy

reportSetStorageType.name: reportSetStorageType
reportSetStorageType.description: Report set table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

reportSetTableChanged.name: reportSetTableChanged
reportSetTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of report set table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

reportSetContentsTable.name: reportSetContentsTable
reportSetContentsTable.description: Content mapping table of all rulesets for threshold management Indexes are from RulesetTable and RuleTable.

reportSetContentsReportIndex.name: reportSetContentsReportIndex
reportSetContentsReportIndex.description: reportSet contents table report number (second index; 1..n; this number is not stored in the ruleset database)

reportSetContentsReportName.name: reportSetContentsReportName
reportSetContentsReportName.description: reportSet contents table report name - this name must match to an entry in the reportSet table! If the report is missing in the reportSet table, it will be ignored here.

reportSetContentsRowStatus.name: reportSetContentsRowStatus
reportSetContentsRowStatus.description: Report set contents table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

reportSetContentsStorageType.name: reportSetContentsStorageType
reportSetContentsStorageType.description: Report set contents table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

reportSetContentsTableChanged.name: reportSetContentsTableChanged
reportSetContentsTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of ruleset contents table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

reportHighestIndexInUse.name: reportHighestIndexInUse
reportHighestIndexInUse.description: the highest available index in the ValueRecordTable.

reportOldestIndexInUse.name: reportOldestIndexInUse
reportOldestIndexInUse.description: the index of the oldest value in the ValueRecordTable. index-1 ist the most current value.

reportValueRecordTable.name: reportValueRecordTable
reportValueRecordTable.description: Record Values of an appointed report. Starts with index 1 and ends with index HighestIndexInUse This table is now OBSOLETE (may take too much time to browse it when it gathered too many data records). The report values have to be read by using ServerView Remote Connector service.

reportValueRecord.name: reportValueRecord
reportValueRecord.description: Record value of the report in XML format

threshResourceTable.name: threshResourceTable
threshResourceTable.description: Available resources for threshold and report management

threshResourceDescription.name: threshResourceDescription
threshResourceDescription.description: Short description of the resource (for display in front end applications)

threshResourceHelpText.name: threshResourceHelpText
threshResourceHelpText.description: Detailed description of the resource (for dynamic generation of help pages)

threshResourceReqType.name: threshResourceReqType
threshResourceReqType.description: Resource request type - defines how to get the value (by SNMP, Windows Registry, for built-in the objects 'ReqString' and 'InstNameReq' are not needed)

threshResourceReqString.name: threshResourceReqString
threshResourceReqString.description: Resource value request string: An asterisk '*' marks an enumeration of multiple values and can only stand at the end of the request string. SNMP: '1.3.6.1.4.1.231.2.10.2.2.5.1.3.*' Windows Registry: 'HKLM\Software\FSC\key\@value' 'Software\FSC\key\@*' Root keys (can be omitted): HKLM = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (default) HKCU = HKEY_CURRENT_USER HKCC = HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG HKPD = HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

threshResourceInstNameReq.name: threshResourceInstNameReq
threshResourceInstNameReq.description: Resource instance name request string (syntax and type like threshResourceReqString)

threshResourceRowStatus.name: threshResourceRowStatus
threshResourceRowStatus.description: Resource table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

threshResourceStorageType.name: threshResourceStorageType
threshResourceStorageType.description: Resource table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshResourceValueUnit.name: threshResourceValueUnit
threshResourceValueUnit.description: Unit of a value of this resource. E.g. '%','MByte'

threshResourceContainerName.name: threshResourceContainerName
threshResourceContainerName.description: Name of the container which contains ReqString. SNMP: contains the MIB name

threshResourceGroupName.name: threshResourceGroupName
threshResourceGroupName.description: Name of the group the resource belongs to

threshResourceTableChanged.name: threshResourceTableChanged
threshResourceTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of resource table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

threshTargetTable.name: threshTargetTable
threshTargetTable.description: Target destination names for threshold/report resource value reading Allows to send value requests to more than one target machines.

threshTargetAddress.name: threshTargetAddress
threshTargetAddress.description: Resource target address (string) This may be an IP address (dotted string representation) or a DNS name.

threshTargetRowStatus.name: threshTargetRowStatus
threshTargetRowStatus.description: Resource target table row status (RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB) supported values: active, createAndGo, destroy

threshTargetStorageType.name: threshTargetStorageType
threshTargetStorageType.description: Resource target table storage type (see RFC2579; see comment on top of this MIB)

threshTargetTableChanged.name: threshTargetTableChanged
threshTargetTableChanged.description: Timestamp indicating last modification of target table (time_t format: seconds since 1970/01/01)

threshTrapInfoServerName.name: threshTrapInfoServerName
threshTrapInfoServerName.description: Name of the server the trap comes from

threshTrapInfoTime.name: threshTrapInfoTime
threshTrapInfoTime.description: Time when the trap occured (in seconds since 01/01/1970 00:00h)

threshTrapInfoRuleName.name: threshTrapInfoRuleName
threshTrapInfoRuleName.description: The name of the rule which met condition

threshTrapInfoRuleValue.name: threshTrapInfoRuleValue
threshTrapInfoRuleValue.description: The value that of the resource that met condition (single or average value; numeric values are converted to strings)

threshTrapInfoRuleUserComment.name: threshTrapInfoRuleUserComment
threshTrapInfoRuleUserComment.description: The user's description of the rule which met condition; user may define an action what to do when an event raises
